question.text: Select the correct sequence for transport of sperm cells in male reproductive system.

options.text: Testis <math><mo>→</mo></math> Epididymis <math><mo>→</mo></math> Vasa efferentia <math><mo>→</mo></math> Rete testis <math><mo>→</mo></math> Inguinal Canal <math><mo>→</mo><mi> </mi></math> Urethra

Seminiferous tubules <math><mo>→</mo></math> Rete testis <math><mo>→</mo></math> Vasa efferentia <math><mo>→</mo></math> Epididymis <math><mo>→</mo></math> Vas deferens <math><mo>→</mo></math> Ejaculatory duct <math><mo>→</mo><mi> </mi></math> Urethra <math><mo>→</mo></math> Urethral meatus
Seminiferous tubules <math><mo>→</mo></math> Vasa efferentia <math><mo>→</mo></math> Epididymis <math><mo>→</mo></math> Inguinal Canal <math><mo>→</mo></math> Urethra

Testis <math><mo>→</mo></math> Epididymis <math><mo>→</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi></math> Vasa efferentia <math><mo>→</mo></math> Vas deferens <math><mo>→</mo></math> Ejaculatory duct <math><mo>→</mo></math> Inguinal Canal <math><mo>→</mo></math> Urethra <math><mo>→</mo></math> Urethral meatus

solution.text:
The correct sequence of the pathway of sperm in male reproductive system is as follows:

Seminiferous tubules → Rete testis → Vasa efferentia → Epididymis → Vas deferens → Ejaculatory duct → Urethra → Urethral meatus
